author: DANIEL ZELTER
subject: Re: Rupan on DVD?!
body:
"Hopefully we'll have a new dub of Legend of Gold Babylon and of course the 
previously released Sub/dub of Fuma Conspiracy."

Nah, Animeigo should stick to what they know best. Subbing. :)

"Given the paltry Lupin offerings on DVD such as Mystery of Mamo, (dub only, 
pretty sad when a dual language LD of this exists already in the Japanese 
market) I don't hold much hope for Lupin on DVD in english."

Cagliostro did incredibly well, and Manga's considering buying more Lupin, 
so let's hope they're smart and they buy Walther.

"The entire first series could easily done on two DVD-18's (dual sided dual 
layer) and include the BGM bonuses and both versions of the pilot film."

Yeah, but the animation for the first series is only slightly better than 
Starblazers. And most newbie fans think that if it looks like Tenchi or 
Armitage III(as in cel quality), then that's automatically all that matters.

"By the way, this is my first post to the list"

I'm just surprised the petition's already reached over 200 in just a few 
months after Cagliostro was released. I know that's not a lot, compared to 
say, the petition to get the DB manga uncensored, but for Lupin, that's 
pretty significant. Anyway, now another Lupin question. I saw From Russia 
with Love, and I noticed that it was made around the early 90's. And does 
anyone else think that Fujiko dressed up a little like Cindy Crawford in 
that one?
